item.title: 95/L32 – Stella
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Stella Christ the man vegges out with A Streetcar Named Desire, a half-rack and a pint of Cherry Garcia because sometimes a man needs to kick off his shoes, curl up under an old wool blanket and let go the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Stella

Christ the man vegges out
with A Streetcar Named Desire,
a half-rack and a pint of Cherry Garcia
because sometimes a man needs
to kick off his shoes, curl up
under an old wool blanket
and let go the angry man
at the Plaid Pantry ranting
about gov’t healthcare,
sidestep the gutterpunks
asking for money to feed
their menagerie, say thanks
but no thanks to the woman
with the bright and twitchy smile
canvassing for a worthy cause.
Sometimes a man just needs
to let it be. Also: Brando.
So he locks the door,
cracks a cold one,
and for just one night
lets the great world spin.

item.title: 94/L31 – Phone
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Phone Christ the man calls his brother on the phone every weekend. Like clock work: an hour, to the minute, every Sunday. It’s mostly silence and heavy breathing. What the other does, what the other might have been goes unsaid. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Phone

Christ the man calls
his brother on the phone
every weekend.
Like clock work:
an hour, to the minute,
every Sunday.
It’s mostly silence
and heavy breathing.
What the other
does, what the other
might have been
goes unsaid. Grief
is the electric hollow
of an open line.
Every hour ends
the same: time up,
right hands spread wide,
fingers and palms matched
in width and color,
pressed to thick glass
that says all they
never will. Led away
without the other,
alone again. But not
alone. Not ever.

item.title: 93/L30 – Feast
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Feast Christ the man ponders the hop-along pigeon chasing bread crumbs at the back of the brutal flock. She’s missing her left foot toes, torn off or ignored by life’s dark machinery. Peg-leg bird hobbling. Always the last to feed, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Feast

Christ the man ponders
the hop-along pigeon
chasing bread crumbs
at the back of the brutal flock.
She’s missing her left foot
toes, torn off or ignored
by life’s dark machinery.
Peg-leg bird hobbling.
Always the last to feed,
doomed never to mate,
the least of these
hundred others.
She knows no other.
Unruffled, she flaps
flying into the scrum
to win her dear portion.
He leads her away
to feast on fresh bread,
a whole baguette, hers,
for the pecking. No fight
or flight. Her hidden coloring
flashes in the sun.

item.title: 92/L29 – Miracle
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Miracle Christ the man startles the ghost out of the machine. In a noisy airport bathroom the paper towel appears with a wave of his hand. Faucets and urinals run of their own accord. The spirit moves. Men filter in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Miracle

Christ the man startles
the ghost out of the machine.
In a noisy airport bathroom
the paper towel appears
with a wave of his hand.
Faucets and urinals run
of their own accord.
The spirit moves. Men
filter in and out, moving
in an unspoken dance,
bearing every manner of dress
and language, each intent
on destinations they know
intimately and not at all.
They will plane and deplane
in distant cities
and think nothing of it,
complaining of lost time
or kneeling to greet their children.
They will step down out of the air
as if it is their right.
He will meet them there.

item.title: 91/L28 – Crown
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Crown Christ the man smokes a hand-rolled cigarette with the kid at the bus stop since he offered. He hears about neck tattoos covering bruises, about sleeping in the waiting room, about mornings made of shaking hands. He learns the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Crown

Christ the man smokes
a hand-rolled cigarette
with the kid at the bus stop
since he offered. He hears
about neck tattoos covering
bruises, about sleeping in
the waiting room, about mornings
made of shaking hands.
He learns the shape and weight
of what Gabriel carries,
if that is his name
stitched above his heart.
The smoke demons his lungs
and stains his fingers.
He crushes it beneath his heel
but will wake tasting it,
his mouth sour and stale.
It will burrow into his clothes.
He will learn to wear it
like a crown.

item.title: 90/L27 – Massage
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Massage Christ the man succumbs to hands upon his body. Gentle pressure comes with violence. Muscles tensed and knotted quaver against the bone, cry out. He knows himself as a sapling shaken by wind. In softened dark, amidst the brethren … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Massage

Christ the man succumbs
to hands upon his body.
Gentle pressure comes
with violence. Muscles
tensed and knotted quaver
against the bone, cry out.
He knows himself as a sapling
shaken by wind.
In softened dark,
amidst the brethren
and their quieting canting,
alone again. Smell of cedar.
His body comes slowly back,
all the broken bits aligning.
So many parts
gone so horribly wrong
to make him whole.

item.title: 89/L26 – Cedar
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Cedar Christ the man tastes cedar on the wind. Rain storms its way down valley swamping the low-lands. The crops he tilled last week may drown or survive. Far west an eagle turns a slow swath, ignoring the coming storm. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Cedar

Christ the man tastes
cedar on the wind. Rain
storms its way down valley
swamping the low-lands.
The crops he tilled last week
may drown or survive.
Far west an eagle turns
a slow swath, ignoring
the coming storm. Lord
of the air claims his own.
Lord of the air rides out
what comes to shake him.
He leans to on the porch,
waiting. The first drops fall,
the smell of cedar rises.

item.title: 88/L25 – Grappling
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Grappling Christ the wrestles his own salvation with fear and great trembling.
item.content:encoded:
Grappling

Christ the wrestles
his own salvation with fear
and great trembling.

item.title: 87/L24 – Men
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Men Christ the man centered among men. At table, at work, at play. Sanded skin conducts crisp current. So many minds he longs to pick the lock of. Settles for the press of chest to chest, slow breath, the deep … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Men

Christ the man centered
among men. At table,
at work, at play.
Sanded skin conducts
crisp current. So many minds
he longs to pick the lock of.
Settles for the press of chest
to chest, slow breath, the deep
well of eye to eye in a man
well met or wounded. He centers
himself among men
to find how it is to lose
himself, to be found.

item.title: 86/L23 – Grief
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Grief Christ the man braids no whip, raises no fist. In protest he embodies the blows felt near and far by each body dropped carelessly as it was shouldered, by every body made less than least. He laments that man … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Grief

Christ the man braids
no whip, raises no fist.

In protest he embodies the blows
felt near and far

by each body dropped
carelessly as it was shouldered,

by every body made less
than least.

He laments that man
does not lament.

He abides in love;
he does not forget.
